bullets.text: Fed holds policy rate steady, citing improving economy; signals patience on cuts while monitoring inflation and labor-market risks.
FOMC reaffirms longer-run framework: 2% inflation goal and employment shortfalls focus, anchoring reaction function despite near-term political noise.
S&P 500 reaches 7,000, extending risk-on rally; leadership rotation suggests broader participation beyond megacaps.
Gold jumps to fresh highs after Fed hold, reflecting hedging demand and shifting rate expectations amid mixed global equities.
Microsoft shares fall on slowing cloud growth and cautious margin outlook, highlighting AI-capex pressure versus revenue growth.
Meta rallies on upbeat revenue forecast while Reality Labs losses persist, indicating investors prioritize AI-driven advertising growth over metaverse spending.
Tesla reports weakening profitability and first annual revenue decline; strategic shifts include scaling back legacy models and investing in xAI.
Amazon cuts about 16,000 roles, signaling continued cost discipline and organizational simplification as AI investment rises.
AI-chip supply tightness boosts memory/test equipment outlook: Samsung profit triples; Advantest and Micron rise on AI-driven demand signals.
Southwest ends open seating and adds monetization levers (assigned seats, bag fees), forecasting materially higher 2026 profits; investors approve.
U.S. escalatory rhetoric toward Iran and related security cases raise regional conflict risk premiums, with potential implications for shipping and energy markets.
Venezuela oversight proposal and renewed output ambitions highlight oil-supply geopolitics; returning to 3M bpd would require sustained capital and stability.
Research warns low-Earth-orbit congestion could trigger cascading collision risk within days, underscoring urgency for debris mitigation and space-traffic governance.
New AI biology tools and immunotherapy insights: AlphaGenome predicts variant effects; studies identify mechanisms behind immunotherapy failure, guiding more precise treatments.
